Title: ZAMB! Biomutant Extermination
Genre: Action , Indie , Strategy
Developer: Nano Games
Publisher: Kasedo Games
Release Date: Jun 20, 2014

Visit the website View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups

Buy ZAMB! Biomutant Extermination

$9.99
Add to Cart
 

Reviews

“ZAMB! Biomutant Extermination feels like an old arcade game, the kind where you stand with your buddies for hours as you celebrate every victory and curse every defeat.”
4/5 – Co-Optimus

About This Game

Play as two special operatives and fight your way through a mad scientist's secret asteroid base whilst defending yourself against his army of evil mutants. The amazing brawler Cye is trained in melee combat and uses powerful gadgets of mass destruction; or out-smart the enemy with the master tactician Chrome, an agent of ranged warfare and master of AI turret defence systems.

Develop the skills of your Agent, increase their power and overcome 24 uniquely challenging levels which get harder as you progress. Will you use a “punch now, ask questions later” approach? Or are you a tactical genius that tricks the enemy into bottle necks, melting them down with a devastating turret barrage?

Play solo, or draft in a loyal friend for epic Co-op action. Use everything at your disposal in order to eliminate the mutant army and put a stop to their evil before it spreads across the universe.

Final Game Features

24 Scientific Labs to Dominate and 3 Environments to Conquer – Hack the power cells in 24 action packed levels and take over the mad scientist’s asteroid base.

14 Powers and Turrets – Combining your strategic mind with a Brawling skill set you will have to use everything at your disposal to defeat the waves of mutants.

Over 200 upgrades for each character – Increase your range, power up your damage, or upgrade your AoE radius to better dispose of the vile mutants.

17 Unique Enemies – Defend against mutant Wasps, Scorpions with blasters, exploding Ticks and the titanic Crusher Bugs.

3 Challenging Bosses – Face off against the most destructive scientific experiments created by the mad scientist

Replayability – Unlock achievements and star related challenges through every level, adding extensive replayability and bragging rights!
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Microsoft Windows XP SP3 + .NET Framework 3.5, Vista, 7, 8
    • Processor: AMD Athlon 64 2800+, Intel Pentium 4 2.4 GHz, Intel Core 2 1.8 GHz or equivalent.
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: OpenGL 3.2 (DirectX 10 equivalent) graphics card: ATI/AMD Radeon HD 2xxx or higher, NVIDIA GeForce 8xxx or higher.
    • Hard Drive: 400 MB available space
    • Sound Card: OpenAL compatible sound card.
    • Additional Notes: On-board graphic cards may not work properly. It is not recommended to run a game with that kind of device.
    Recommended:
    • Processor: Intel Core i7 2600K
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 680
    • Additional Notes: On-board graphic cards may not work properly. It is not recommended to run a game with that kind of device.

7 reviews
Not Recommended
1.6 hrs on record
Posted: May 9
Worst game I've ever played. The two character types aren't even remotely balanced. My brothers sound wouldn't work when we first tried playing. Game is glitchy as hell. Had to reset 25+ times from getting warped into the walls and being stuck inside of them. I've fallin through the world to my death. The creatures fall through the world but somehow can still kill the reactors. Being able to put two towers on a bonus spot. Throwing a bomb perfictly on the creatures, only to have it do zero damage to the creatures and take 3/4 of my life. I can't believe I wasted 98 minutes of my life on this, i'm sure 30+ were troubleshooting my brothers sound issues. Can I get a refund?

Hosinator
46 products in account
2 reviews
Not Recommended
1.6 hrs on record
Posted: May 9
This game is horrible. Not just because the sound wouldn't work without having to manually install openal after none of the forum support applied to my issue. The two characters are horribly unbalanced with one building turrets and the other just getting abilities that cost resources but are one-shot uses. I played primarily in two player co-op, and the frist 3 levels my co-op partner kept getting knocked off the world or trapped inside walls. Horrible. Playing co-op with a camera angle that makes me want to beg someone for the ability to adjust it myself vs the horrible angles it picks. It's too bad in this day and age two people playing a game together on the internet are stuck feeling like they are sharing a tv in an old nintendo multiplayer game. After 96 minutes, I've deleted it and will never re-install it. I love TD games, and TD games with hero characters, but this one is the worst I've ever played. Would not recommend to anyone that is serious about a good tower defence game.

SpentFern
9 products in account
2 reviews
Recommended
54.9 hrs on record
Posted: April 13, 2014
Early Access Review
This game is a blast. It reminds me alot of orcs must die, so those of you who enjoyed that game will definitly enjoy this.

THe gameplay is fast paced and fun, youre always active during the game even when you seting up trap in between waves. There's also a decent vaiety of power ups and torrents, so your never really stuck using the same old traps. the power ups and torrents are upgradeable so that extra boost in power/range/life, will also just make things alot easier to win. Online gameplay for this game will come at a later day, but judging based on the single player and co-op, this game is definitly worth buying.

If you are looking for the next fresh game on the market then I highly recommend this once its a fair price for what you get and the developers did say that they will be updating the game every week with new stages , maybe some more power-ups and torrents, and online gameplay so you can play with your friends.

Faraleth
779 products in account
67 reviews
Recommended
2.4 hrs on record
Posted: June 8, 2014
Early Access Review
ZAMB! Biomutant Extermination is an interesting concept of tower defence and isometric brawler or shooter mechanics thrown into one, with a whacky and vibrant comical theme to it. The game is currently said to contain around a third of all content that will be available on the full release according to the developer, but it is highly playable and feels fairly complete outside of the lack of levels.

However, it has some serious tightening up to do in terms of the mechanics, because while it presents a fantastic idea, it simply becomes a chore to play due to the poor combat and frustrating AI. I certainly recommend ZAMB! Biomutant Extermination as something you keep your eye on, because what is there is fairly promising, but from what I’ve seen, it’s nothing more than promise due to its fundamental technical issues. If they were improved, I would have a much easier time recommending it, but as it stands, I’d say hold off until significant improvements are made.

YouTube™ Video: AlphaLegion PREVIEW: ZAMB! Biomutant Extermination
